<ce:table colsep="0" frame="topbot" id="t0005" rowsep="0" xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/cals/dtd">
<ce:label>Table 1</ce:label>
<ce:caption id="cn0085">
<ce:simple-para id="sp0100" view="all">The relationship between the synthetic conditions and the formation of these compounds.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:caption>
<tgroup cols="7">
<colspec align="left" colname="col1"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col2"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col3"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col4"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col5"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col6"></colspec>
<colspec align="left" colname="col7"></colspec>
<thead>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">Salt</entry>
<entry nameend="col4" namest="col2" rowsep="1" xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">EuCl<inf loc="post">3</inf>·6H<inf loc="post">2</inf>O</entry>
<entry nameend="col7" namest="col5" rowsep="1" xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">Eu(NO<inf loc="post">3</inf>)<inf loc="post">3</inf>·6H<inf loc="post">2</inf>O</entry>
</row>
<row rowsep="1" valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">pH</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>L1</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>L2</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>L3</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>L1</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>L2</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>L3</bold>
</entry>
</row>
</thead>
<tbody>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">3</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>1</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>4</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>2</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">4</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>1</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>4</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>2</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">5</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>1</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>3</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>2</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>3</bold>
</entry>
</row>
<row valign="top">
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">6</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>1</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>3</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">none</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>2</bold>
</entry>
<entry xmlns="http://www.elsevier.com/xml/common/dtd">
<bold>3</bold>
</entry>
</row>
</tbody>
</tgroup>
<ce:legend>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0105" view="all">
<ce:bold>L1</ce:bold>: Htzpya; <ce:bold>L2</ce:bold>: Hatzpa; <ce:bold>L3</ce:bold>: Hpytza.</ce:simple-para>
<ce:simple-para id="sp0110" view="all">
<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>: [Eu(tzpya)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">5</ce:inf>]Cl·4H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O; <ce:bold>2</ce:bold>: [Eu<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(atzpa)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">8</ce:inf>](NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·2H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O; <ce:bold>3</ce:bold>: [Eu(pytza)<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>·2<ce:italic>n</ce:italic>H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O; <ce:bold>4</ce:bold>: [Eu(pytza)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>(H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O)<ce:inf loc="post">4</ce:inf>]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>Cl<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic>.</ce:simple-para>
</ce:legend>
</ce:table>
clean_text:
Table 1. The relationship between the synthetic conditions and the formation of these compounds.

| Salt | EuCl3·6H2O | Eu(NO3)3·6H2O | EuCl3·6H2O | Eu(NO3)3·6H2O | EuCl3·6H2O | Eu(NO3)3·6H2O |
|------|-----------|---------------|------------|---------------|------------|---------------|
| pH   | L1        | L2            | L3         | L1            | L2         | L3            |
| 3    | 1         | none          | 4          | none          | 2          | none          |
| 4    | 1         | none          | 4          | none          | 2          | none          |
| 5    | 1         | none          | 3          | none          | 2          | 3             |
| 6    | 1         | none          | 3          | none          | 2          | 3             |

Legend: L1: Htzpya; L2: Hatzpa; L3: Hpytza.
1: [Eu(tzpya)2(H2O)5]Cl·4H2O; 2: [Eu2(atzpa)4(H2O)8](NO3)2·2H2O; 3: [Eu(pytza)3(H2O)2]n·2nH2O; 4: [Eu(pytza)2(H2O)4]nCln.
